idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

descript.abstract: United States Counties is a polygon theme representing the counties of the United States in the 50 states, the District of Columbia, and Puerto Rico.
descript.purpose: United States Counties provides boundaries and demographic information for the U.S. counties. The boundaries are consistent with the tract, block group, and state data sets and are effective at county, regional, and state levels.
descript.supplinf:
Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:50,000.
This dataset includes an ESRI layer file symbolizing the number of farms per square mile

citeinfo.title: United States Counties, 2010
citeinfo.origin: Economic and Social Research Institute (Reston, Va.)

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States: Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/company/locations.html.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

enttyp.enttypd: A type of governmental unit that is the primary legal division of every state except Alaska and Louisiana. A number of geographic entities are not legally designated as a county, but are recognized by the U.S. Census Bureau as equivalent to a county for data presentation purposes. These include the boroughs, city and boroughs, municipality, and census areas in Alaska; parishes in Louisiana; and cities that are independent of any county (independent cities) in Maryland, Missouri, Nevada, and Virginia. They also include the municipios in Puerto Rico. Because they contain no primary legal divisions, the Census Bureau treats the District of Columbia as equivalent to a county (as well as equivalent to a state) for data presentation purposes.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRIÂ® software.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

srcinfo.srccitea: Tele Atlas MultiNet North America Administrative Areas v. 2010.03

citeinfo.title: Summary File 1 (SF1)
citeinfo.othercit: The Summary File 1 (SF1) data is based on the 2000 Census of Population.

citeinfo.title: 2007 Census of Agriculture
citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS)

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS)

citeinfo.othercit: The farm attributes come from data published by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS) based on the 2007 Census of Agriculture.

citeinfo.title: The World Factbook
citeinfo.othercit: The Factbook has been an annual publication, but selected data and maps are updated periodically online.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted the county data set from Tele Atlas MultiNet Administrative Areas v. 2010.03. Clipped the coastline with the Tele Atlas MultiNet North America water data set. Removed the U.S. Virgin Islands. Attached and formatted the fields from 2009 Data Update U.S. Counties. Replaced field POP2009 with POP2010 and field POP09_SQMI with POP10_SQMI. Renamed the four agriculture fields to NO_FARMS07, AVG_SIZE07, CROP_ACR07, and AVG_SALE07 and got new values from the 2007 Census of Agriculture. Put "-99" values into all number type fields (except SQMI) for records where there were no matches. Calculated new values for fields POP00_SQMI, POP10_SQMI, and SQMI from the MultiNet field FEATAREA. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGISÂ® layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal positional accuracy is dependent on geographic area. In most areas, accuracy is between 5 and 25 meters (16 and 82 feet). In some areas, accuracy is off by up to several tens of meters (100 feet or more). In the poorest areas, accuracy is off by up to 100 meters (328 feet).

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either tools in ArcGIS or ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2). The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
